University Entrance Tuition

Elite preparation for STEP, MAT, TMUA, and AEA to secure places at Oxford, Cambridge, Imperial, and Warwick.

Check Availability View Curriculum
THE REALITY

Why students struggle at this level.

  • Finding that A-Level Maths knowledge is not enough to solve admission problems.
  • Struggling with the non-standard, open-ended nature of STEP/MAT questions.
  • Running out of time due to the intense pressure of the paper.
  • Anxiety about the 'Grade 1' or 'Distinction' requirement for your offer.
The GG Method

How we secure the top grades.

  • Problem-Solving Toolbox: We teach you specific heuristics to attack problems when you have no idea where to start.
  • Olympiad-Style Training: Moving beyond 'methods' to deep logical reasoning and proof construction.
  • Past Paper Deconstruction: We don't just solve papers; we dissect the examiner's logic so you can predict the next step.
  • Mock Interview Prep: Many of these questions are discussed in interviews. We train you to vocalise your mathematical thinking.
Secure your University Entrance Grade

More Than Just Tutoring

A holistic approach designed for high performance.

The 'Stuck' Framework

In these exams, getting stuck is normal. We teach you a mental protocol to unstick yourself using small cases, simplification, and working backwards.

Rigorous Marking

STEP requires perfect written communication. We mark your work exactly as a Cambridge examiner would, penalising poor notation or gaps in logic.

Timed Conditions

Speed is the enemy. We practice time-management strategies to ensure you pick the questions that yield the highest marks in the shortest time.

Common Questions

When should we start preparing?

Ideally, Year 12. STEP and MAT require a different way of thinking that takes 6-12 months to develop. Cramming a few weeks before the exam rarely works.

Do you help with the Personal Statement?

Yes. We can guide you on which mathematical books to read and how to discuss them in your statement to demonstrate genuine passion to admissions tutors.

What is the difference between STEP and MAT?

MAT (Oxford) is taken in October/November and tests aptitude/speed. STEP (Cambridge) is taken in June (end of Year 13) and tests deep mathematical stamina and technical ability.

My school doesn't offer STEP support. Can you help?

This is very common. Most schools do not have the resources to teach to this level. We provide the full curriculum support you would get at a top private school.
